title.rendered: Financial Commission Appoints Roberto d’Ambrosio to its Dispute Resolution Committee (DRC)

content.rendered:
February 13th, 2019, The Financial Commission today announces the appointment of former Alpari Research & Analysis CEO, Roberto d’Ambrosio to its Dispute Resolution Committee (DRC).

Enhancing the DRC structure

Mr. D’Ambrosio is the 22nd industry expert to join the Financial Commission’s DRC – which consists of a diverse panel of industry professionals, who follow a non-bias protocol to process and resolve complaints from our members’ clients.

Roberto has over 18 years’ experience in Financial Services and deep knowledge of trading techniques and trading flows with particular reference to FX transactions. He has a holistic knowledge when it comes to trading, being an expert programmer (he had developed hundreds of algos and risk management systems), a double certified risk manager and, before holding senior executive positions in leading brokerage firms like FXDD, Tier1fx, and Alpari, having served as institutional advisor to hedge funds and mutual funds.

Peter Tatarnikov, Financial Commission Chairman, commented the appointment: “Roberto has a solid background in risk management and trading that he approaches from many angles, so his input will surely be significant in assisting with the resolution of disputes. His experience as a mentor will also help us educate traders throughout the resolution process as well”.

About Roberto d’Ambrosio

Besides being the Co-Founder, CEO and CIO of Araknos Investment Managers, Roberto is involved in a number of prestigious roles, including non-executive directorships within regulated financial services firms. He is also a well-known trading and investment mentor and has held a number of educational seminars worldwide. Roberto holds a BA in Corporate Law services, he is an EMBA candidate at the Henley Business School, University of Reading, and holds the MITC Diploma in risk management in financial services and the RIMAP/Ferma certification in Risk Management.

About Financial Commission

Founded in 2013, the Financial Commission is a leading independent member-driven external dispute resolution (EDR) organization for international online brokerages, exchanges and Blockchain firms that participate in global foreign exchange (forex), derivatives, CFD and digital asset markets.

Financial Commission provides efficient compliance solutions to its members, alongside its External Dispute Resolution (EDR) mechanism that serves as an effective channel for processing complaints from clients of member firms.

For more information please contact us at info@financialcommission.org.
